description: small black hat; thin brim with silk mesh over grid-like weave pattern; vertical cylinder slightly tapering to the top
text: Hats like this one, called gat in Korean, are made of horsetail hair and silk on a bamboo frame. In the 1800s they were only worn by married, middle-class men. Gat rode atop the head (rather than low on the brow like Western hats), were worn over an inner hat called a tanggeon, and were tied under the chin with black cords that might fall as low as the man’s lower torso.
